abstract.p: Jean Mercer letter says school districts ought not to force students to transfer when they move to new neighborhood in middle of school year (S)

block.p: Your May 25 front-page news article about teacher and student turnover notes some reasons for student turnover that are beyond the control of the schools.
However, school systems countrywide can control one rule that increases turnover: the one requiring children to change to a new school when they move out of the district.
Your May 25 front-page news article about teacher and student turnover notes some reasons for student turnover that are beyond the control of the schools.
However, school systems countrywide can control one rule that increases turnover: the one requiring children to change to a new school when they move out of the district.

Many schools insist on immediate transfer even when there are only a few weeks left in a school year and when parents would be happy to provide transportation to the familiar school. Children who move to a new home because of marital disruption frequently experience school changes at a time when they are least able to cope with it.
Some of the characteristic alienation of many high school students may be traceable to the insensitivity of school districts to these issues.
